sets.name: Table Manners
review: If you"re with a dinner party and receive drinks, you should wait to begin drinking. After everyone is served, someone will take the lead to make a speech, and then raise his/her glass and yell, "Kampai!", meaning cheers.

You will receive a small wet cloth at most Japanese restaurants. Use this to wash your hands before eating. Carefully fold and set it aside on the table. Do not use it as a napkin, or to touch a part of your face.
Slurping noodles or making loud noises while eating is OK! In fact, slurping hot food like ramen is polite, to show you are enjoying it.
Before eating anything, itâ€™s polite to say "itadakimasu" meaning "I will receive". You should be saying this regardless if you are going to eat a seven-course meal or a sample at a supermarket.

quiz.prompt: What should you do when given a wet towel at a restaurant?

answers.text: Use it to clean your hands and face
Place it on your lap as you would with a napkin

quiz.prompt: How much should you tip in Japan?

answers.text: Tip only if you feel like the service was good

quiz.prompt: What is proper etiquette for eating noodles?

answers.text: Eat slowly and refrain from making slurping noises.
Slurping loudly is OK to do and actually preferred.
Twirl your noodles with your fork before eating.
